title: Watch: Eyewitness captures video of Colorado attack scene
summary: Eight people are being treated for injuries after a man 'started setting people on fire' at a mall in Boulder, Colorado, on Sunday . Authorities say the suspect was seen throwing Molotov cocktails, and using other devices to hurt people .

title: Al-Qaida affiliate attacks Mali army bases as junta struggles to contain jihadist threat
summary: An al-Qaida-linked group has launched an assault on a Malian army base in Timbuktu . The attack comes a day after it claimed responsibility for another attack near the border with Burkina Faso . As many as 30 soldiers were killed in the attack .

title: German court rules asylum seekers unlawfully expelled at Polish border
summary: Three Somali nationals were turned back at a train station in Frankfurt an der Oder, a city on Germany’s eastern border . Officials cited the asylum seekers’ arrival from a “safe third country” as grounds for their refusal . But the court determined the expulsion was illegal under European Union rules, specifically the Dublin regulation .

title: Russia banned from ice hockey in 2026 Olympics
summary: The IOC has ruled to extend sanctions imposed on Russian and Belarusian teams . IOC has made the decision to ban Russian ice hockey teams from the upcoming Winter Olympics in Italy . The IIHF, like many other international sports organizations, banned athletes from both nations .

title: Zelensky says Ukraine has invitation to attend NATO summit
summary: Vladimir Zelensky said Ukraine has been invited to the NATO summit scheduled to take place in The Hague at the end of June . The New York Times previously wrote that T.Yegor Chernev, head of the Ukrainian delegation to NATO Parliamentary Assembly, said that NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte evaded giving a direct answer . The newspaper also said Trump is backtracking on commitments to join sanctions against Russia .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: An Israeli strike on Gaza kills 14 Palestinians, mostly women and children, hospitals say
summary: Israel-Hamas war began when Palestinian militants stormed into Israel on October 7, 2023, killing some 1,200 people, mostly civilians . Israel says it only targets militants and tries to avoid harming civilians . Hamas has said it will only release the remaining hostages in return for a lasting ceasefire and an Israeli pullout .

title: 'Could not stand the sight of two men loving each other': Jonathan Joss' husband on how 'King of the Hill' voice actor was killed in Texas shooting
summary: Jonathan Joss' husband: 'Could not stand the sight of two men loving each other' 'King of the Hill' voice actor was killed in Texas shooting .

title: Deadly flooding in Nigeria displaces thousands
summary: Nigerian officials estimate that over 500 people are still missing and presumed dead . U.N. agencies and partners are working alongside the Nigerian Government to provide essential humanitarian aid . Flooding in Nigeria has become more severe in recent years .

title: How the FBI and Big Ag Started Treating Animal Rights Activists as Terrorists
summary: The government–industry fearmongering has accelerated with the spread of COVID . A coalition of transparency and animal rights groups released that letter, along with a cache of government documents, to highlight the tight links between law enforcement and agriculture industry groups . The FBI defends its relationship with “members of the private sector” in a statement .
